citation.article-title: Chimaereicella alkaliphila gen. nov., sp. nov., a Gram-negative alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from a nonsaline alkaline groundwater.

p.s: Chimaereicella (Chi. mae. rei. cel’ la; L. adj. chimaereus, of or pertaining to the Chimaera – a mythological monster with the fore part a lion, in the hinder a serpent, and in the middle a goat; L. fem. n. cella, chamber/cell; N.L. fem. n. Chimaereicella, a chimeric cell – a cell that lies between Algoriphagus and Hongiella).
Chimaereicella forms long rod-shaped cells that stain Gram negative.
Mesophilic, chemoorganotrophic, strictly aerobic, oxidase positive and catalase positive.
Fatty acids are predominantly iso-branched and the respiratory quinone is MK7.
This genus belongs to the family “Flexibacteriaceae”.
The type species is Chimaereicella alkaliphila.
